holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year's Day, which is on January 1, or the first day of the year in the Gregorian Calendar, is a public holiday in Germany.

holidays.name: Epiphany
holidays.description: Epiphany on January 6 is a public holiday in 3 German states  and commemorates the Bible story of  the Magi's visit to baby Jesus.

holidays.description: Franco-German Day is a observance in Germany

holidays.description: Children's Hospice Day is a observance in Germany

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: Valentine’s Day is a special time to celebrate love, romance and friendship.

holidays.name: Shrove Monday
holidays.description: Carnival Monday is two days before Ash Wednesday and parades are held in many Catholic areas of Germany.

holidays.name: Carnival / Shrove Tuesday
holidays.description: Shrove Tuesday is a religious holiday that is on the day before Ash Wednesday. It is also known as the Tuesday of Carnival, which is a festive occasion among many cultures.

holidays.name: Carnival / Ash Wednesday
holidays.description: Ash Wednesday marks the first day of Lent in western Christian churches.

holidays.name: St. Patrick's Day
holidays.description: St Patrick’s Day celebrates Irish culture and commemorates one of Ireland’s patron saints, St Patrick, on or around March 17.

holidays.name: Palm Sunday
holidays.description: Palm Sunday is a Christian feast that commemorates Jesus Christ’s entry into Jerusalem. It is also the start of Holy Week.

holidays.name: Maundy Thursday
holidays.description: Maundy Thursday is a Christian observance on the Thursday during Holy Week. It is the day before Good Friday.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Many Christians in Germany observe the Good Friday public holiday to mark the crucifixion of Jesus Christ.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday is a holiday in Germany to celebrate the Jesus Christ's resurrection, according to the Christian Bible.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday is a holiday in Germany to celebrate the Jesus Christ's resurrection, according to the Christian Bible.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Many people in Germany annually observe Easter Monday on the day after Easter Sunday. It is a public holiday in all states.

holidays.description: German Beer Day is a observance in Germany

holidays.name: Walpurgis Night
holidays.description: Walpurgis Night is a observance in Germany

holidays.name: May Day
holidays.description: May Day in Germany is a holiday to celebrate the start of spring and to campaign for workers' rights. It is always on May 1.

holidays.name: Europe Day (Council of Europe)
holidays.description: Europe Day (Council of Europe) is a observance in Germany

holidays.name: Anniversary of the End of World War II

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Father’s Day celebrates fatherhood and male parenting on different dates worldwide.

holidays.name: Ascension Day
holidays.description: Ascension Day in Germany is on a Thursday 39 days after Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Peace Festival in Augsburg
holidays.description: The Augsburg Peace Festival in Germany celebrates the implementation of the Peace of Westphalia in 1648 CE. It is on August 8 each year.

holidays.name: Assumption of Mary
holidays.description: The Feast of the Assumption of Mary is an occasion for Catholics to honor the belief that God assumed the Virgin Mary to heaven. It is a public holiday in some parts of Germany on August 15 each year.

holidays.description: German Unity Day celebrates Germany's unification in 1990. It is on October 3 each year.

holidays.name: Reformation Day
holidays.description: Reformation Day in Germany is annually observed on October 31 to remember the Reformation, a time of big religious change between 1517 CE and 1648 CE.

holidays.name: Halloween
holidays.description: Halloween is a festive occasion that is celebrated in many countries on October 31 each year.

holidays.name: All Saints' Day
holidays.description: All Saints' Day is an annual public holiday in five German states to remember all Christian saints on November 1.

holidays.description: Night of Broken Glass Remembrance Day is a observance in Germany

holidays.name: Fall of the Berlin Wall
holidays.description: Fall of the Berlin Wall is a observance in Germany

holidays.name: St. Martin's Day
holidays.description: St. Martin's Day is celebrated in Germany every year on November 11.

holidays.name: National Day of Mourning
holidays.description: On the National Day of Mourning (Volkstrauertag) many Germans commemorate all victims of war and tyranny.

holidays.name: Repentance Day
holidays.description: The Day of Prayer and Repentance is a Protestant holiday and a public holiday in the state of Saxony (Sachsen) on the last Wednesday before November 23.

holidays.name: Sunday of the Dead
holidays.description: The Sunday of the Dead in Germany is an occasion to remember those who have passed away.

holidays.name: First Advent Sunday
holidays.description: The first Sunday of Advent marks the beginning of the Christian year.

holidays.name: Second Advent Sunday
holidays.description: Second Advent Sunday is a observance and Christian holiday in Germany

holidays.name: Saint Nicholas Day
holidays.description: St. Nicholas Day is celebrated on December 6 in many European countries, as well as areas across the world that boast a strong European influence.

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve is the day before Christmas Day and the start of the Christmas celebration. It always falls on December 24 in Germany.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christmas Day marks the birth of Jesus Christ and is a public holiday in Germany. It is on December 25 each year.

holidays.name: Boxing Day
holidays.description: The Second Day of Christmas is a public holiday in Germany. It always falls on December 26.

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: New Year's Eve in Germany is annually celebrated on December 31. It is the last day of the year in the Gregorian calendar.
